m_szDocTitle: New Graphene + Carbon Nanotube Supercapacitor Rivals Lithium Battery | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: New Graphene + Carbon Nanotube Supercapacitor Rivals Lithium Battery May 12th, 2014 by Tina Casey   An international team of researchers has come up with a recipe for a microscale flexible energy storage device made of graphene and carbon nanotubes, which can store enough energy to rival the gold standard, lithium batteries. That’s significant because the device is actually not a battery, it is a supercapacitor that can charge and discharge much faster than a battery. It’s also significant because the research team has devised a fabrication method that results in a long fiber (long as in 50 me
